author: be5invis
body:
This is an follow-up to #1908 and #2145.

For `Native | PS` piping, we should able to write cmdlets that takes **raw bytes** and returns whatever they like.

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body: I'm not sure I understand the intent here. Can you provide some examples illustrating what you mean? Thanks.

comments.author: powercode
comments.body: One example that I have run into is `p4.exe` where `-G` makes it produce python dictionaries as it's record instead of text. And to produce .net objects from that, it would be really nice to have simple access to the raw stream of bytes.

title: Cmdlets that takes bytes as input
